revised_title: Auto-suspension of Transported Sediment and Turbidity Currents: A Discussion on the Mechanisms and Limitations
tldr: The author discusses the mysterious behavior of fine sediment in rivers and the conditions that enable submarine turbidity currents to transport sand and silt over long distances. They propose an energetics-based approach to explain the auto-suspension of sediment and the reversal of concentration gradients. The author also provides a criterion for the self-maintenance of turbidity currents and suggests that these phenomena can be studied and reproduced in the laboratory.
